comment.text: This translation key is used for a notification message when a user is not found. The message will appear in a UI element displaying an error or exception related to a payer's information, likely on a SaaS payment settings page.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Arabic translation includes angle brackets '<1>' and '</1>' which mirror the English. While technically correct, this is often unnecessary and makes the translated text less readable in Arabic. Consider removing these.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the angle brackets: "المستخدم {{email}} غير موجود."

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Armenian translation uses a colon (:) at the end of the sentence, which might not be idiomatic or preferred in all contexts. It's generally more natural to omit it in this type of error message.
The Japanese translation retains the HTML-like tags '<1>' and '</1>' which are not necessary and are unusual in standard Japanese text. These tags should be removed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ユーザー{{email}}が見つかりません。

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'O utilizador' is too literal. A more natural phrasing would be 'O usuário'.
The phrase 'não foi encontrado' is correct but sounds a bit formal. A more common and conversational phrasing would be 'não existe'.

The English phrase "User" is not accurately translated. "Perishreelakaya" (පරිශ්‍රීලකයා) is a less common and potentially confusing word for 'user'. A more common and understandable translation would be "Vartheetha" (වර්ථීත) or "Grahaththaya" (ග්රාහකයා).
The formatting of the email placeholder is consistent with the English. It's important to maintain this consistency.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure the email placeholder `<1>{{email}}</1>` remains unchanged in the Sinhala translation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Корисник <1>{{email}}</1> није пронађен.' is a generally accurate translation of "User <1>{{email}}</1> is not found.", but a more natural phrasing in Serbian would be 'Корисник <1>{{email}}</1> није откривен' or 'Постоји проблем са корисником <1>{{email}}</1>'. The word 'пронађен' (pronadjen) can sometimes feel a little formal or literal in this context.

The translation 'Không tìm thấy người dùng<1>{{email}}</1>.' is a literal translation and sounds unnatural in Vietnamese. A more natural phrasing would be 'Không tìm thấy người dùng với email <1>{{email}}</1>.' or 'Không tìm thấy người dùng <1>{{email}}</1>.', depending on the desired level of formality.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Không tìm thấy người dùng với email <1>{{email}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The `<1>` and `</1>` tags are preserved in the translation, which might not be necessary and can look awkward. The tags should ideally be handled by the system rendering the text, not be part of the translated content.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the tags <1> and </1> and let the system handle the formatting.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "未找到用户 <1>{{email}}</1>." is a literal translation, but in Chinese, it would be more natural to say "找不到用户 <1>{{email}}</1>."  '未找到' implies a lack of searching/attempt, whereas '找不到' implies the user simply cannot be found.
